intro: Damnacanthus major var. parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaf horse-hoof, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
